p: An in vitro study on the HepG2 cell model showed that the polysaccharide from Grifola frondosa significantly increases glucose metabolism and stimulates the synthesis of intracellular glycogen through the Akt/GSK-3 pathway. Polysaccharide from G. frondosa activated IRS and increased Akt expression, which leads to an inhibition of GSK-3 [ 68].
